Text.Value: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*
Sorry - I thought you might need fresh drinks.
*A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
I hear the Absolute in you.
*Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
Yes. Drink will help me to sleep again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Drunk and tired, satisfied to have been offered alcohol

Text.Value: Huh? I was sleeping with the rest of you. No idea who made that racket.
Go away, True Soul. I need sleep.
Nothing. I'll break your skull!

EditorData.NodeContext: 'nothing' is a reaction to not receiving the booze he was promised. He's furious.

Text.Value: Good. Go now. And do not wake me again.
Go away, drow. I need sleep.
I don't take orders from you. Kill 'em!

EditorData.NodeContext: angry, shouting to nearby goblins to attack on final phrase

Text.Value: I'll rip your tongue, break your legs, make you quiet.

EditorData.NodeContext: increasing fury on the rhythm of these three phrases, but quietly sinister, not shouted

Text.Value: Too much talking. Too much noise. Glath, glath. You die now!

EditorData.NodeContext: Shaking away the drunkenness as he prepares to fight. glath (glaff) means 'blood', here it's a threat - 'you will bleed'.

Text.Value: Rather break bones than drink more. Your bones.

EditorData.NodeContext: tired and annoyed, about to attack us

Text.Value: You dare speak to me like that? Go back to sleep.
*A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
Go back to sleep before I put you to sleep.
Attack.
Stupid pests. The next person that wakes me dies.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rubbing his head to clear a headache and sleepiness. Has just been convinced that 'goblins' made the noise that woke him and is annoyed but isn't going to do anything about it

Text.Value: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
*The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.
EditorData.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

Text.Value: Grashmog... araga ghistpok araga...

EditorData.NodeContext: Goblin language words muttered in his sleep (Grash rhymes with crash, a-rah-ga, hard g on 'ghist' and pok rhymes with lock)

Text.Value: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
What did you bring for me?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Checking his inventory - maybe shot from waist up, looking down at hands as we're supposed to have passed him something

Text.Value: Sleep is for the weak. I could have killed you where you lay.
*As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
Do not disturb me again, True Soul.
No more excuses. I'll crack your skull!

EditorData.NodeContext: just woke up with a bad hangover, angry enough to attack us

Text.Value: You dare speak to me like that? Go back to sleep.
Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Text.Value: You are right. You are strong. But if you wake me again, I will kill you.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a shake of the head - backing down from a fight. Sinister smile on final phrase

Text.Value: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
SLEEP, OR DIE. YOUR CHOICE.
*Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Synopsis: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
